answers.author: Matthew Reges
answers.text:
The social sciences and criminal justice literature has touched on this question; I remember a couple of discussions in school. But your nearest university CJ or PA school might help. A professor could get you some graduate research or even an intern for the question.
There are academic journals like Crime & Delinquency, The Prison Journal, and Criminal Justice & Behavior through which you might search. This is an older paper finding no harm to property values: http://www.tippecanoe.in.gov/egov/docs/1203448928_100158.pdf 
Lastly, I did an MPA capstone paper related to a new jail project. The local opposition had little to do with property values and more to do with the facility's cost and the fiscal strain of debt service and running costs.

author: Ashley Jacobs
text: We're in the process of building a new jail, and nearby residents are concerned about how this will impact their property values.  Does anyone know where to find data?
title: Impact of new jail on property values?
